header.#text: Verification regarding residential energy conservation measures

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may increase the dollar amount limitations pursuant to

with respect to
			 a project due to residential energy conservation measures for the project
			 only if the

text.#text: The

in the case of a mortgage insured under this section financing repair and rehabilitation of the
			 project, verifies that a third-party assessment procured by the lender or
			 borrower has been conducted of the project’s physical needs, including an
			 energy audit and identification of cost-effective opportunities for
			 increasing energy and water efficiency and achieving a reduction in energy
			 and water costs, and such assessment indicates that the energy
			 conservation measures to be installed will be cost-effective over the life
			 of the measures; and

ensures that the project is provided information that will enable the project to verify and monitor
			 the energy savings achieved by the energy conservation measures on a
			 voluntary basis.

quote.#tail:
means, with respect to a project, any measure that will result in a reduction in energy, water, or
			 gas consumption for the project.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall carry out a program to be known as the
			 Multifamily Housing Energy Innovation Plan to make grants to eligible
			 entities to establish or expand an energy savings plan that uses
			 innovative approaches to reduce energy, water, and/or gas consumption in
			 multifamily housing.

text.#text: the extent to which the energy savings plan would reduce budgetary expenses for the
Amounts from grants under this section may be used only for energy savings plans that—

are financing demonstrations for multifamily housing, including for financing through credit
			 enhancements, revolving loan funds, loan loss reserves, interest rate
			 subsidies, loan insurance, or other financing methods approved by the

create green jobs, including in the fields of construction, property management, and technical
			 analysis, that directly promote the adoption of energy savings measures in
			 multifamily housing, including energy savings plans that create green jobs
			 for low-income families;

acquire and analyze data on the costs, benefits, challenges, and opportunities associated with
			 retrofitting multifamily housing for energy efficiency; or
research and implement a demonstration project that—

addresses the split incentive problem, including implementing changes to methods for utility
			 metering in multifamily housing;

creates a system for benchmarking, tracking, and sharing energy consumption statistics for
			 multifamily housing; or
achieves another goal as approved by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that will result in at least a 20-percent
			 reduction in the energy, water, or gas consumption of multifamily housing
			 and a description of the methodology to be used to compute the reduction
			 in energy consumption.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Multifamily Housing Energy Efficiency Improvement Act of 2014/s:4/ss:c/p:1

text.#text:
Amounts from a grant under this section may be used only to carry out an energy savings plan
			 described in

An eligible entity that receives a grant under this section shall contribute towards the energy
			 savings plan amounts from private, nonprofit, or government sources that
			 are not less than the amount of the grant.
Grants shall be awarded for a period not to exceed 24 months.

In this section the following definitions shall apply:

term.#tail: means a partnership between 2 or more of the following entities:

text.#text: The term
A State or unit of local government.
A provider of utility services.
A community housing development organization as defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 104 of the Cranston-Gonzalez
			 National Affordable Housing Act

text.#text: A public housing agency as defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 3(b) of the United States Housing Act of 1937

text.#text: A non-profit or for-profit entity whose primary business is management of multifamily housing.

term.#tail:
means a program, project, or activity for energy savings or water and gas efficiency in
			 multifamily housing.

term.#tail: means, with respect to multifamily housing, a situation in which—

text.#text: The term

the occupant of a dwelling unit in the housing does not pay for energy, water, or gas consumption
			 for such unit and is not incentivized to implement an energy savings
			 measure; or

the owner does not pay for energy, water, or gas consumption for dwelling units in the housing and
			 is not incentivized to implement an energy savings measure.

term.#tail:
means each of the several States, the District of Columbia, and any territory or possession of the
			 United States.
